WorkItem.Description:
I have PHP excel 1.6.4.
I create an xlsx file 'on the fly' (that means the user is prompted to download the xlsx file immediately instead of saving it in the disk).
When I import with the require_once command a required class in order to query database and collect data the xlsx gets corrupted.
I observed that the class had two extensions e.g MyClass.class.php . I removed the .class and it worked fine.
A workaround is to rename all my classes to not have the .class extension but to be in MyClass.php format.
But I think this is something that needs to be fixed.
Â 
Thank you
WorkItem.Summary: PHP Excel generates corrupted file when libraries/classes with double extensions are included

Comments.Message: This is really strange behaviour. Is it possible to attach your source code to this work item?
Disregard this issue. This was my mistake. The class files had some blank lines after the last closing php tag (?>) so that produced some output that was corrupting the xlsx. Sorry
